Events that occurred on 14 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1904 – At the age of 34, Mabel Tolkien dies after six days in a diabetic coma.
1907 - Swedish author Astrid Lindgren is born.
1955 - The first episode of 1955 radio series of The Fellowship of the Ring airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1962 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to H. Cotton Minchin.
1964 - The sixth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
1968 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 307.
1986 - The Shaping of Middle-earth is published in the US.
1990 - The War of the Ring is published in the US.
2003 - Tolkien Through Russian Eyes is published.
2019 - The Hobbit Sketchbook is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
